maml:description.maml:para: Get a desired configuration setting and its metadata.

Get the metadata of a setting in a scenario. The metadata includes the name, description, authority, drift control, data type, and value of the setting. If no setting is specified, all settings in the scenario are returned. If the Raw parameter is specified, only the value of the setting is returned.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
Return the value of the setting.
Do not refresh the setting and leave documents in place.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
Return the value of the setting.
Do not refresh the setting and leave documents in place.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the metadata of all settings in the scenario.
Gets the metadata of the setting in the scenario.
Gets the value of the setting in the scenario.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a scenario definition and its metadata.

Get the scenario definition metadata. The metadata includes the name, description, version, status, and settings of the scenario. The status indicates whether the scenario is available, installed, or active. If no scenario is specified, all scenarios are returned.
The name of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the metadata of the scenario.
Gets the metadata of the scenario with the specified version.
Gets the metadata of all scenarios.

maml:description.maml:para: Install a scenario definition.
Install a scenario definition. If a scenario definition with the same name and version already exists, the cmdlet will attempt to patch the existing scenario definition.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Remove a desired configuration setting.
Remove a desired configuration setting. If no setting is specified, all configured settings for the given scenario are removed.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all configured settings for the scenario.
Removes the configured setting for the scenario.

maml:description.maml:para: Set a desired configuration setting.

Set a desired configuration setting. A setting can be set to a specific value or to its default value (defined in the scenario definition). If no setting name is provided, all settings in the scenario are set using the value.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
The value of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
Use the default value of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the scenario.
The name of the setting.
The value of the setting.
Use the default value of the setting.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the value of the setting.
Sets the value of the setting to its default value.
Sets the value of all settings in the scenario.
Sets the value of all settings in the scenario to their default values.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstall a scenario definition.
Uninstall a scenario definition. The cmdlet will remove the scenario definition and all associated settings that have been configured.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the scenario.
The version of the scenario.
The GUID or name of the authority.
The flag for proceeding without interaction.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
